subject: Re: Basic newbie questions
author: M.A. Coletta (Mike)
full_text:
Hi Leslie,

To get you started...

Mini Box - (about $400 - $500)
http://www.paranormalsystems.com/The_MiniBox.html

Frank's Box - (Not for sale, he offers them to people every once-in-
awhile)
http://www.franks-boxes.com

There are many other websites that offer information on Franks Box, 
too.

Joe's Box - (Price ???)
http://www.keyportparanormal.com

Radio Shack Hack - ($25 - $100) I've put together a number of 
configurations using the Radio Shack Hack 12-469 & 12-470.  You can 
see the detailed videos here: http://www.youtube.com/ufogeek
You can also see some of my Radio Shack Hack photos here:  
http://www.ufogeek.com

Many other people are putting together different configurations of 
the Radio Shack Hack, and they share their findings on this forum.

Digital Dowsing - (Price ???)
http://www.digitaldowsing.com

Welcome... I'm sure others will provide additional information, as 
many of the researchers here have their own websites. This is a very 
friendly place!

- Mike


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Aquarius <laustin@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, all! 
> 
> I'm a newbie to this list, and very excited about what I've been 
reading the
> last week or so.
> 
> Briefly, though I am a corporate consultant and exective coach by
> profession, I've been a channel since 1971, working with one 
(wonderful)
> guide. I've also done lots of psychic work over the years, had lots 
of
> experiences, and consider the unseen world as "normal" and real as 
our
> so-called ordinary world.
> 
> I have wanted for years to try recording voices of my unseen 
associates, and
> am SO excited to begin to experiment, so I thank you all for the 
invaluable
> information I'm reading on this list so far!
> 
> I have some very basic questions, and apologize if they are too 
simple or
> repetitious for the more experienced and regular members of this 
list.
> 
> When some of you are mentioning that your mini-box is on the way, 
from where
> are you buying it? What other systems are available, other than 
making one
> with the Radio Shack radios (which I will experiment with for 
sure!).
> 
> Would it be possible to list the possible other equipment that one 
might
> buy, and the sources? Or is this already available somewhere on the
> yahoogroups website for this group?
> 
> Thanks in advance to one and all for any help you can give me with 
this...
> there's SO much great info here it's a bit hard to sort out as a 
newbie on
> the list who just dove in recently!
> 
> Cheers,
> 
> Leslie (in NYC)
> 
> "A hunch is creativity trying to tell you something."
> 
> 	-- Frank Capra, Film Director
> 
> "Honor your error as a hidden intention."
> 
> 	-- Brian Eno
>
